intro: Audibertia incana, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense, spherical heads, resembling a dandelion. Audibertia incana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
